title: Will audio lore become the new standard?

embed.description: Listen as Lars spins a tale of four Bilgewater legends - Nautilus, Fizz, Tahm Kench, and Pyke - and discovers the terrifying fact woven into his fiction. Click on the links below for more.

body:
Or is it supposed to be a one-time thing?

Reading the stories aloud and putting them up on official channels makes them more approachable to players who don't want to read through walls of text, or wouldn't otherwise want to spend time browsing through the universe site for lore; the quality of the Legends of Bilgewater videos seems promising, too.

In general, the videos are good, and it'd be a waste if this was done only for the current event.

I greatly enjoyed this presentation. The audio added a superb degree of immersion.
Wooo! Happy the audio and sound design was able to help elevate your immersion in these awesome stories!

I love it. It really helps put the "Legend" in "League of Legends." I immediately started wondering what else you guys could do with this sort of storyteller style format. You could have a Freljordian telling stories of the old gods, the devilish Watchers and their servants, and of the mighty heroes of the land. Or a member of Malzahar's cult giving their perspective on the monsters from the Void, and the fools who would oppose them.

I can personally say that I'm excited to see what all you guys will do with these audio dramas. I especially love that you're starting off strong by using regular Runeterrans as storytellers for these (tell Lars he was amazing), but I have a feeling you guys know there's still room for particularly interesting stories to tell through audio dramas.

Just as an example, it'd certainly be interesting to see a first-person narrative with a Champion with, more or less, many voices (Darha/Karma,  Kayn, Varus come to mind - Varus especially) told in this style.

Definitely looking forward to what you guys'll do with it down the road, though!
